result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Christy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concur to 15CF89. Early termination after 18 mo if petitioned by agent and no new crimes rising to level of PC.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim or any pawn/resale shop.

Def to file a monthly report with agent detailing income, expenses & restitution paid. Def to file tax returns each yr with copy to agent and any refunds to restitution.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A Christy
